I am investigate on the problem, and i find which

I find a solution calling MeasureOverride before BringIndexIntoView ;
WorkItem.Summary: NullReferenceException when add now row e press enter key

Comments.Message: I am not able to repro the issue.  Could you provide a repro solution?

The same error happens when I try deleting a row from a WPF datagrid that has more than one rows. If the datagrid has only one row, then delete works fine. The workaround proposed here solved the issue.

We were able to reproduce the issue with TestDataGrid.zip. If you make ListEntity derive from ObservableCollection instead of MultiThreadingObservableCollection, then the application does not produce the exception. The issue likely arises due to the asynchronous reporting of collection changes, which is causing confusion within the control because the data is in one state while the visual containers are in another.
